results.title: Miss Mrs and Myths (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
This program looks closely at the wide range of myths and attitudes of contemporary society toward women as members of the workforce. The historical precedents for current attitudes are revealed, and facts, opinions and testimonies are presented to counter the claims of myths.

Originally produced: Adelaide : Open College of Further Education, 1979.
Women as workers (Miss, Mrs, myths) producer, Kay Hannaford ; script, Cate Kelly and Kay Hannaford.

results.title: Search and rescue
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Explains the ways in which search and rescue can be facilitated should the crew in distress observe certain basic procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer.

results.title: Australia at school
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows a range of schools from small country towns through to high schools in Sydney, grades from kindergarten to last year of high school. “A film outlining Australia’s system of primary and secondary education”. Cinematography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: Scouting in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Joe Scully, Australian Boy Scouts Association and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the impact upon a boy of his joining the Scouts, the involvement of his father in the Movement, the Scouts’ work in the community and the international status of the Scouting Movement. Includes scenes of a Scout Rally, an investiture, a Group Committee and the ‘Jamboree of the New Endeavour’ at Leppington, N.S.W

results.title: In-shore waters
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines some basic navigational and safety rules small craft should be aware of when boating in waters used by commercial shipping. Cast: Alan Doggett, Bob Hicks.

results.title: November = Novembre
results.creator_credit: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hundred and one lingering, luminous impressions of the month when the ripe fullness of the Canadian autumn wilts and the whole earth seems to settle into brooding calm. This is a cine-poem, reflecting the somber moods of November, the still, waiting separateness when the Canadian year dawdles, hangs back from the hour when the first snowfall will make all things even. But from the muted tones of the dying season emerges a new, stark beauty. Film without words. (Contains images of duck hunting and animial skinning that may offend some viewers.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: C.E.P. What's that Got to Do with Being Here?
results.brief_description: The C.E.P. (Country Education Project) is an innovative body designed to tackle the industrial needs of rural communities. The projects are either school or community based, depending on individual educational requirements, and have a full-time regional co-ordinator. Outlines the C.E.P. philosophy and takes a close look at programs currently operating in the Ovens and King Valley regions of Victoria.
results.title_for_label: C.E.P. What’s that Got to Do with Being Here?

results.title: Hassles
results.creator_credit: Ross Simmons, Jason Ollivier, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: One of three films as part of the National Drug Education Program which takes an in-depth view of drug addiction in the day-to-day lives of ordinary people. The central character is a teenage boy who found the courage to give up heavy marijuana smoking. His motive was simply the challenge itself, but the price of his success is rejection by his lifelong friends and associates who accuse him of simply substituting one source of stimulation for another. Photography by Dean Semler. (See also ‘Thirst’ [012683] and ‘All in the same boat’ [012758].)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ross Simmons, Jason Ollivier, Robin Hughes and Film Australia

results.title: Skilled craftsmen: five Australians
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lot of people consider craft a hobby. Something which is undertaken as a source of relaxation and self fulfilment. Many people, however, treat the crafts as a professional livelihood. This film shows the lifestyle of five of these people, each illustrating a different facet of the crafts: Joe McBain, a blacksmith; David Wright, a stained glass artist; Lilija Duks, a weaver; Greg Wain and Victoria Howlett, potters. Narrated by Rod Mullinar
